subject: Career
title: Confirmation Bias in Interviews
description: A 60-second lesson on Confirmation Bias in Interviews.

hook.text: An interviewer reads your resume and forms an opinion. The interview becomes a search for proof.

buildup.text: Confirmation bias: we seek information that supports what we already believe.

discovery.text: If they liked your resume, they'll hear your strengths. If not, they'll notice every flaw.

twist.text: Structured interviews reduce this â€” same questions, same order, scored on rubrics.

climax.text: As a candidate, your best defense is a strong opening. It sets the confirmation in your favor.

punchline.text: Bias is the default. Structure is the fix.

quiz.question: How does confirmation bias affect interviews?
options: Interviewers seek evidence supporting their initial impression
They forget everything after the interview
They always prefer the last candidate
